statement.p: Consider a spring-mass system where a weight is resting on a frictionless table. We let d(t) denote the distance from the wall (where the spring is attached) to the weight at time t in seconds and know that the weight oscillates periodically with a minimum value of 2 feet and a maximum value of 7 feet with a period of 2 \pi. We also know that d(0) = 4.5 and d\left(\frac{\pi}{2}\right) = 2.
Determine a formula for d(t) in the form d(t) = a\cos(t-b)+c or d(t) = a\sin(t-b)+c. Is it possible to find two different formulas that work? For any formula you find, identify the anchor point.
